DIVISION 3. - PERMITS; INSPECTIONS; APPROVAL 

Sec. 7-100. - Permit-Required; application; to whom issuable. 
(a)  Before any person shall enter upon the installation, construction, reconstruction or repair of any gas piping, appliances, fixtures or apparatus or any change thereof, he shall apply for and receive a permit for such work from the gas inspector at the office of said inspector, making such application on forms provided for that purpose by the gas inspector. The person applying for the permit shall give a description of the work proposed to be done and the location, ownership, occupancy and use of the premises in connection therewith. The gas inspector may require plans, specifications or drawings and any such information as he may deem necessary and pertinent, prior to the granting of the permit. 
(b)  It shall be unlawful for any person, whether acting as principal, servant, agent or employee, to do, or cause, or permit to be done the installation, construction or repair of any gas piping, appliances, fixtures or apparatus, for which a permit is required within the city, without first securing a permit from the gas inspector, authorizing him so to do. 
(c)  No permit shall be issued to any person to do, or cause to be done, any such work, who does not hold a valid, unexpired and unrevoked certificate of competency as required by this article. 
(Code 1956, § 14-5.1(a), (b)) 
Sec. 7-101. - Gas inspection fees. 
    Every applicant for a permit required by section 7-100 shall pay to the city for each permit issued, payable at time of issuance; and additionally when additional inspections are required, at the time of such inspections, a fee in accordance with the following schedule and at the rate provided as follows: 
SCHEDULE FOR GAS INSPECTION FEES 
Regular Hours After Hours For each job or each separate reinspection caused by fault or neglect of applicant $45.00 $100.00  
    Where regular hours are defined as 7:00-3:30, Monday-Friday, (exclusive of holidays) and after hours are any other times. 
(Code 1956, § 14-5.1(g); Ord. No. 196-2003, § VIII, 6-24-2003) 
Sec. 7-102. - Same-Effect of issuance. 
(a)  The issuance or granting of a permit or approval of plans and specifications shall not be deemed or construed to be a permit for authority to violate or cancel any provision of this article. 
(b)  The issuance of a permit upon plans and specifications shall not prevent the gas inspector from thereafter requiring a correction of errors in said plans and specifications or from preventing construction operations being carried on thereunder when in violation of this chapter or any other ordinance of the city. The holder of the certificate of competency may also be suspended, and further permits and inspections refused until such work done shall have been corrected. 
(Code 1956, § 14-5.1(c), (d)) 
Sec. 7-103. - Same-Expiration. 
    Every permit issued by the gas inspector under the provisions of this article shall expire by limitation and become null and void, if the work authorized by such permit is not commenced within sixty (60) days from the date of such permit, or if the work authorized by such permit is suspended or abandoned at any time after the work is commenced for a period of ninety (90) days. Before such work can be recommenced a new permit shall first be obtained. 
(Code 1956, § 14-5.1(e)) 
Sec. 7-104. - Material; workmanship. 
    All material and workmanship must conform to the city requirements and the city reserves the right to inspect and approve or disapprove any part of construction or to test and approve or disapprove any material at any time. All gas fitting must be accomplished by a master gas fitter licensed by the city, and must comply with the city gas code. All gas lines laid in the city and/or outside the city to be accepted for perpetual maintenance by the city, must be accomplished by a master gas fitter licensed by the city. 
(Code 1956, § 14-7(c); Ord. No. 49-1979, § 6, 4-17-79; Ord. No. 147-1990, § 1, 6-19-90) 
Sec. 7-105. - Inspections. 
(a)  Rough piping inspection shall be made after all new piping authorized by the permit has been installed, and before any such piping has been covered or concealed or any fixtures or gas appliances have been attached thereto. See section 210 of the Standard Gas Code. 
(b)  Final piping inspection shall be made after all piping authorized by the permit has been installed and after all portions thereof which are to be concealed by plastering or otherwise have been so concealed, and before any fixtures or gas appliances have been attached thereto. This inspection shall include a pressure test, as provided in section 210 of the Standard Gas Code. 
(c)  Final inspection shall be made on all new gas work authorized by the permit and such portions of existing systems as may be affected by new work or any changes, to insure compliance with all the requirements of this Code and to assure that the installation and construction of the gas system is in accordance with approved plans. 
(d)  All tools, apparatus, labor and assistance necessary for the tests shall be furnished by the installer. 
(Code 1956, §§ 14-5.3, 14-8; Ord. No. 49-1979, § 4, 4-17-79) 
Sec. 7-106. - Service lines, installation and inspection. 
(a)  All natural gas service lines from the gas meter to the property line or easement installed in the city shall be installed by a pipe fitter licensed by the city. 
(b)  All natural gas service lines from the gas meter to the main gas line installed in the city shall be inspected by the city. 
(Ord. No. 142-1986, § 2, 8-12-86; Ord. No. 184-1987, § 2, 9-8-97) 
Secs. 7-107-7-109. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 4. - INSTALLATION STANDARDS; APPLIANCES 

Sec. 7-110. - Standard Gas Code-Adopted by reference. 
    The current edition of the Standard Gas Code, as published by the Southern Building Code Conference International, Inc., in each of its sections, is hereby adopted and shall constitute the gas code of the city, subject to such alterations, changes, amendments and additions thereto as are herein provided. 
    Said Standard Gas Code has been signed by the mayor and city clerk of the city for identification with this chapter. 
(Ord. No. 82-1996, § 2, 4-23-96) 
Sec. 7-111. - Same-Severability. 
    Each phrase, sentence, paragraph and section of the Standard Gas Code herein adopted is hereby declared to be severable and independent, and should any such phrase, sentence, paragraph or section be declared invalid by any court of competent jurisdiction, such declaration shall not affect the operation of the remaining portions thereof. 
Sec. 7-112. - Same-Penalty for violation. 
    Anyone who violates the provisions of the Standard Gas Code as adopted and amended herein shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction shall be punished as provided in section 1-8 of this Code of Ordinances. The conviction for such violation on any occasion shall not prevent prosecution for subsequent violations and each day that the Standard Gas Code as adopted and amended herein is violated shall constitute a separate offense. 
Sec. 7-113. - Same-Enforcement by injunction. 
    There is reserved to the city the right to proceed to enforce the provisions of the Standard Gas Code as adopted and amended herein by injunction and the conviction for violating its terms shall not in any manner affect or interfere with the right of the city in a civil proceeding to enforce the gas code and its regulations or enjoin the violation thereof. 
Sec. 7-114. - Same-Amendments. 
    The Standard Gas Code, particularly the edition of 1976 with 1977-1978 revisions, is hereby amended in the following respects: 
    Chapter I of said code entitled "Administration" be and same is hereby deleted in its entirety. 
    Chapter II of said code entitled "Gas Piping Installation" and particularly section 204.1 thereof entitled "Minimum Size of Certain Piping Outlets" be amended by amending subsection (a) and by adding subsections (c) through (f) to read as follows: 
"(a) Beginning July 1, 1990, all consumer's gas pipe from the point of delivery to the house piping shall not be less than one (1) inch in diameter. This applies to all service lines installed within the City of Alexandria Gas Distribution System both inside the city limits and outside the city limits." 
"(c) That all service lines shall be at least twelve (12) inches below the surface at the meter and eighteen (18) inches below the surface at the property line to conform with the department of transportation rules and regulations. 
(d) Beginning July 1, 1990, it shall be mandatory that only 3408 PE pipe shall be used when connecting service lines within the city gas distribution system both inside the city limits and outside the city limits. The following procedures must be followed when connecting the 3408 PE pipe for service line installation: 
(1)  When connecting 3408 PE pipe of the same manufacturer; the pipe can only be butt fused by a person certified in the butt fusing procedure by the manufacturer (or his representative). A copy of this person's certification must be on file with the superintendent of the gas department or any fitting approved by the office of pipeline safety may be used. 
(2)  When connecting 3408 PE pipe with different manufacturers; the only approved connection is any fitting approved by the office of pipeline safety. 
(e) All risers from service lines to the meters shall be a minimum of one (1) inch in diameter. 
(f) Procedure in case of repair of gas leaks in service lines shall be as follows: 
(1)  If leak is found on the riser portion of the pipe, the riser may be repaired and a test performed on the service line. 
(2)  If the gas leak is on the service line, then the service line shall be replaced and a test performed." 
    Chapter II of said code shall be further amended and particularly section 207.4 thereof entitled "Buried House Piping" by adding thereto another subsection to be lettered (c) and read as follows: 
"(c) Any gas piping behind the meter and under concrete and asphalt shall be encased and vented to the outside." 
    Chapter II of said code shall be further amended and particularly section 208.4 thereof entitled "Provide Drips and Grade Piping Where Necessary" to read as follows: 
"208.4 Provide Drips and Grade Piping Where Necessary 
    Except where a dry gas is distributed, or where climatic conditions do not make the following requirements necessary, gas piping shall be properly drained with a minimum pitch of approximately one-fourth (1/4) inch in fifteen (15) feet and to as few points as practicable. Drips shall be provided at such points to act as storage for condensate and shall be readily accessible for draining. The diameter of the piping constituting the drip shall not be less than that of the line it serves and the minimum length of the drip piping shall not be less than a minimum of four (4) inches." 
    Chapter II of said code shall be further amended and particularly section 214 thereof entitled "Gas Piping in Mobile Home Trailer Parks and Travel Trailer Parks" be amended by adding thereto a new subsection to be lettered (f) and to be entitled "Furnishing Gas to House Trailers" and to read as follows: 
"(f) Furnishing Gas to House Trailers. The city will furnish gas for any factory made house trailer, even though the pipe sizes therein may not conform to 7-110 of the Alexandria City Code, provided pipe in the trailer will pass the mercury gauge test, as required by the city gas inspector. The city's responsibility will terminate at the meter." 
    Chapter IV of said code entitled "Installation Requirements For Specific Appliances" be amended by adding a new section thereto to be numbered 420.4 and to be entitled "Flame Gas Light" and to read as follows: 
"420.4 Flame Gas Light. The use of open flame gas lights within the city is hereby prohibited." 
    Chapter V of such code be amended by amending section 504.2 concerning "Location" (of water heaters) to delete subsection 504.2.2 therefrom. 
    Chapter VIII of said code entitled "Installation Requirements For Undiluted Liquefied Petroleum Gases (Butane and Propane)" be and same is hereby deleted in its entirety. 
    Chapter IX of said code entitled "Installation Requirements For Residential and Apartment Houses 2-PSIG Gas Piping" be and same is hereby deleted in its entirety. 
    Tracer wire: All tracer wire to locate gas piping of the gas department [shall] be changed to 10-gauge insulated stranded wire. 
Note- See the editor's note following the next paragraph. 
    Elevated test pressure. Beginning July 1, 1990, the test pressure on all service lines shall be elevated to a minimum of seventy-five (75) pounds for a period of fifteen (15) minutes. This applies to all service lines installed within the city gas distribution system both inside the city limits and outside the city limits. 
(Code 1956, § 14-6.1; Ord. No. 49-1979, § 5, 4-17-79; Ord. No. 134-1986, § 2, 7-29-86; Ord. No. 183-1987, § 2, 9-8-87; Ord. No. 264-1989, § 1, 11-14-89; Ord. No. 148-1990, § 2, 6-19-1990) 
Editor's note- Provisions pertaining to tracer wire and elevated test pressure are derived from Ord. No. 264-1989, § 1, adopted Nov. 14, 1989, and Ord. No. 148-1990, § 2, adopted June 19, 1990, which purported to amend § 14-7 by adding subsections (h) and (i). Inasmuch as no specific amendment to the Standard Gas Code, 1976 Edition, or to the 1980 Code of Ordinances was cited, it is presumed that the reference to § 14-7 reflects the numbering system of the 1956 Code of Ordinances, predecessor to this Code. The user's attention is directed to the repealer provisions of the Adopting Ordinance (No. 108-1980) §§ 2 and 3, page vii, at the front of this volume and also to the Code Comparative Table, page 2040. 
Secs. 7-115-7-119. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE IV. - HOUSING CODE 

Sec. 7-120. - Housing code; adopted by reference. 
    There is hereby adopted for the purpose of prescribing a set of minimum housing standards that certain code known as "The 1986 Housing Code, City of Alexandria," of which code not less than three (3) copies have been and are now filed in the office of the city clerk, and have been signed by the mayor and said clerk for identification herewith, and said code is hereby adopted and incorporated herein as fully as if set out at length herein, and from the date on which this section takes effect, the provisions thereof shall be controlling within the city. 
(Code 1956, § 7-7; Ord. No. 41-1981, § 1, 3-17-81; Ord. No. 272-1987, § 2, 12-15-87) 
Sec. 7-121. - Buildings to be secure. 
    Residential or commercial buildings which have code violations and have been determined by the city's building official or his designated representative to be in need of rehabilitation to correct code violations or secured until the violations can be corrected shall be secured according to the following specifications and regulations (set forth in sections 7-122 through 7-126). 
(Ord. No. 221-1988, § 1, 9-9-88; Ord. No. 131-1996, § 2, 6-18-96) 
Sec. 7-122. - Securing specifications. 
(a)  It is hereby required that the securing of all exterior openings be accomplished in a neat, workmanlike manner with not less than one-half-inch thick (CDX) weather-resistant plywood, cut to fit within openings, securely fastened (1) with two and one-half-inch (21/2?) wood screws four (4) to six (6) inches on-center or (2) securing plywood with one-half-inch by eight-inch (1/2? × 8?) round head bolt with washer, through the center of the plyboard with two by four (2? × 4?) backup. The plywood shall also be coated with two (2) coats of exterior paint. Color shall blend with or harmonize with the exterior colors of the building as to be inconspicuous as possible. All bare wood siding, windows, overhang, and trim shall also be coated with exterior paint. In the event the owner wishes to utilize the structure for storage it will be required that a minimum one-and-three-quarter-inch solid core door be installed and equipped with passage lock and one-inch deadbolt lock. 
(b)  It shall be the responsibility of every such owner to keep the premises of such residential or commercial property clean and to remove from the premises all abandoned motor vehicles, iceboxes, refrigerators, stoves, glass, building materials, building rubbish or similar items in addition to seeds, dead trees, trash, garbage, etc., and maintain the grass at a level required by city ordinances in order to prevent the building, structure or property from causing a public nuisance. 
(c)  Secured structures must be maintained according to the above specifications until all code violations have been repaired or until the structure has been demolished according to code requirements. 
(Ord. No. 221-1988, § 1, 9-9-88; Ord. No. 131-1996, § 2, 6-18-96) 
Sec. 7-123. - Time limitations. 
(a)  A special securing permit must be obtained by the property owner within thirty (30) days after the date of the certified letter issued by the building official or his designated representative notifying the property owner, his agent or his representative of the deficiencies of the property. 
(b)  All work pertaining to the securing of the structure must be completed according to the specifications outlined herein within thirty (30) days from issuance of said permit. 
(c)  The expiration date of the special permit will be six (6) months after issuance of same with an automatic renewal of an additional six (6) months. At the expiration of the securing permit, a reevaluation of the structure must be performed to determine if the building has been rehabilitated to meet minimum code requirements. 
(Ord. No. 221-1988, § 1, 9-9-88; Ord. No. 131-1996, § 2, 6-18-96) 
Sec. 7-124. - Permit fees. 
    The fee for a special permit will be fifty dollars ($50.00) per year per structure. 
(Ord. No. 221-1988, § 1, 9-9-88) 
Sec. 7-125. - Inspections. 
    All buildings will be inspected thirty (30) days after the issuance of such permit to determine if the structure has been secured according to specifications outlined herein. In addition, each secured structure will be reinspected every six (6) months to ensure it remains in compliance with these requirements. 
(Ord. No. 221-1988, § 1, 9-9-88; Ord. No. 131-1996, § 2, 6-18-96) 
Sec. 7-126. - Notification of noncompliance. 
    If it is determined at any time upon a follow-up inspection that the building is not being maintained according to specifications the building official or his designated representative will attempt to notify the property owner, his agent or his representative by certified mail that the structure is not in compliance with this article, and he will have ten (10) working days from the date of such notice to correct the deficiencies. 
(Ord. No. 221-1988, § 1, 9-9-88; Ord. No. 131-1996, § 2, 6-18-96) 
Sec. 7-127. - Penalty for failure to comply. 
    The responsible party, whether owner or agent, who fails to comply with sections 7-122 through 7-126 shall be subject to the following: 
(1)  The owner or agent shall be charged with maintaining a nuisance and punished in accordance with section 1-8 of this Code. 
(2)  The city, at its option, shall secure and maintain the unmovable and/or its improvements in accordance with sections 7-122 through 7-126; additionally, the city may provide other maintenance services such as grass cutting, weed abatement, trash and garbage pickup in accordance with R.S. 33:4766. 
(3)  The city shall charge for the services rendered in subsection (1) the actual cost for the provision of those services plus an administrative fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00). The cost of such services shall be paid by the land owner and shall be secured by a privilege and lien upon the unmovable and its improvements in favor of the city in accordance with LSA RS 33:4766 as amended. 
(Ord. No. 221-1988, § 1, 9-9-88; Ord. No. 253-1989, § 2, 10-31-89; Ord. No. 131-1996, § 2, 6-18-96) 
Sec. 7-128. - Standards for demolition. 
    For purposes of demolition, the city hereby adopts, as its minimum standard, the Section 8 Housing Quality Standards Code as set forth in 24 CFR 882.109, et seq.; as from time to time amended. Any existing structures not meeting the standards as set forth therein shall be subject to the process set forth in section 7-129, et seq. 
(Ord. No. 131-1996, § 2, 6-18-96) 
Sec. 7-129. - Failure to rehabilitate. 
    At the expiration of the special securing permit as provided for above, if the property owner has not procured a special renovation permit to rehabilitate the structure, and has failed to begin rehabilitating the property to bring the structure(s) into compliance with applicable building, gas or electrical codes, it shall be presumed that the structure is in a dilapidated and dangerous condition which endangers public welfare in accordance with R.S. 33:4761 et seq. 
(Ord. No. 131-1996, § 2, 6-18-96) 
Sec. 7-130. - Inspection, demolition, notice. 
    Upon the expiration of the special securing permit, the city shall inspect the structure(s) to determine compliance. If the structure is found to be deficient, the city shall begin the procedural process of demolishing the structure in accordance with the code. Notice shall be mailed to the property owner advising that the structure no longer qualifies for any permits with the exception of a demolition permit. 
(Ord. No. 131-1996, § 2, 6-18-96) 
Secs. 7-131-7-135. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE V. - MECHANICAL CODE 

Sec. 7-136. - Adopted. 
    The Standard Mechanical Code, as published by the Southern Building Code Congress International, Inc., in each of its sections, is hereby adopted and shall constitute the mechanical code of the city, subject to such alterations, changes, amendments and additions thereto as are herein provided. 
(Ord. No. 214-1993, § 1, 11-23-93) 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 214-1993, § 1, enacted Nov. 23, 1993, adopted a mechanical code for the city. Such provisions did not specify manner of codification; hence, designation as § 7-136 of Art. V, has been at the discretion of the editor. Additionally, § 3 of such ordinance provided that violation of the mechanical code would be a misdemeanor punishable as provided in § 1-8 of this Code of Ordinances. 
Secs. 7-137-7-139. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE VI. - PLUMBING CODE 

Sec. 7-140. - Standard Plumbing Code-Adopted by reference. 
    The 2000 edition and all future revisions of the Louisiana State Plumbing Code, as published by the Southern Building Code Congress International, Inc., in each of its sections is hereby adopted and shall constitute the plumbing code of the city, subject to such alterations, changes, amendments and additions, thereto as are herein produced. 
(Code 1956, § 22-1; Ord. No. 50-1987, § 2, 3-24-87; Ord. No. 131-2005, § II, 5-12-05; Ord. No. 131-2005, §§ I, II, 5-12-05) 
Sec. 7-141. - Same-Enforcement by injunction. 
    There is reserved to the city the right to proceed to enforce the provisions of said Standard Plumbing Code by injunction and the conviction for violating its terms shall not in any manner affect or interfere with the right of the city in a civil proceeding to enforce the plumbing code and its regulations or enjoin the violation thereof. 
(Code 1956, § 22-2) 
Sec. 7-142. - Same-Amendments generally. 
    Said Standard Plumbing Code is hereby amended in the following respects: 
(1)  Any reference to type "M" copper or galvanized iron for water service use under slab, under any structure is hereby deleted. 
(2)  There shall be no soldered joints in water service under slab in sizes one inch copper or less. Larger sizes shall be joined with silver solder joints. 
(3)  The option to use plastic pipe under slab for DWV is hereby authorized for all buildings. In family dwellings under thirty-six (36) feet high, plastic pipe may be used for dry vents. Plastic pipe may also be used for above slab roof drainage in commercial and industrial buildings. 
(4)  No bituminized sewer pipe or bituminized laminated pipe shall be used for DWV in the city. 
(5)  Any reference permitting the use of galvanized iron pipe for DWV or the use of galvanized iron for flashing of plumbing vents is hereby deleted. 
(6)  Any reference to extra-heavy class cast iron soil pipe is hereby deleted. 
(7)  The use of the New Orleans-Wisconsin fitting is approved for use under code. 
(8)  Floor drains with outlets smaller than two (2) inches and strainers smaller than five (5) inches shall not be permitted in the drainage system. 
(9)  Vents serving one and one-quarter (11/4) inch, one and one-half (11/2) inch and two (2) inch traps shall not be smaller than two (2) inches. 
(10)  Vents serving fixtures with traps larger than two (2) inches shall not be smaller than the trap size. 
(11)  No hub soil pipe and fittings with stainless steel bands shall be allowed under ground or floor slab only for the purpose of cutting in a fitting to make an addition in an existing soil or drain system or to repair a broken line, and then only with the permission of the plumbing inspector. 
(Code 1956, § 22-3; Ord. No. 140-1984, § 2, 7-31-84; Ord. No. 50-1987, § 2, 3-24-87) 
Sec. 7-143. - Same-Amendments specifically. 
    Chapter 1, including the table of contents, of said Standard Plumbing Code is hereby amended to read as follows: 
TABLE OF CONTENTS 
CHAPTER 1-ADMINISTRATION 
Section 101- Title and Scope 102- Organization 103- Powers and Duties of Plumbing Official 104- General Requirements Before Doing Plumbing 105- Certificates 106- Permits 107- Fees 108- Inspections and Tests 109- Cutting of Streets, Sidewalks, etc. 110- Public Protection 111- Restrictions 112- Responsibility and Liability 113- Violations and penalties 114- Validity 115- Conflicting Ordinances  
CHAPTER 1-ADMINISTRATION 
SECTION 101. TITLE AND SCOPE 
    101.1 Title. The provisions embraced within the following chapters and sections shall constitute, be known and cited as `The Standard Plumbing Code." 
    101.2. Code remedial. This code is hereby declared to be remedial, and shall be construed to secure the beneficial interest and purposes thereof, which are health, sanitation, general public safety and welfare, by regulating installation and maintenance of all plumbing. 
    101.3. Scope. The provisions of this code shall apply to every plumbing installation, including alterations, repairs, replacement, equipment, appliances, fixtures, fittings and/or appurtenances thereto, whether or not connected to the city water or sewer system, if within the city; and when outside the city, shall apply if said system is a part of, or extension of, the municipal system. 
    101.4. Maintenance. All plumbing, both existing and new, and all parts thereof, shall be maintained in a safe and sanitary condition. All devices or safeguards which are required by this code shall be maintained in good working order. The owner, or his designated agent, shall be responsible for the maintenance of plumbing. 
SECTION 102. ORGANIZATION 
    102.1. Appointment of a board of master plumber examiners. The board of master plumber examiners shall be under the jurisdiction of the mayor, and shall consist of nine (9) members, having thereon the chief sanitarian of the Alexandria-Rapides Parish Health Unit, the superintendent of the water department; the superintendent of the waste water department; the plumbing inspector for the city; two (2) members from the rolls of professional plumbers licensed to do business in the city one of which is to be a minority plumber, to be selected by the mayor, subject to confirmation by the council; two (2) members of the Alexandria-Pineville Plumbing, Heating and Cooling Contractors Association licensed to do business in the city to be selected by the mayor, subject to confirmation by the council, from four (4) nominees to be submitted by the Alexandria-Pineville Plumbing, Heating and Cooling Contractors Association; and one (1) member being a mechanical engineer to be selected by the mayor, subject to confirmation by the council, from (3) nominees to be submitted by the Alexandria Chapter of Louisiana Engineering Society. The appointed members of the board shall be appointed for and shall serve for four (4) years, unless separated from office for any cause. 
    102.2. Duties. The board of plumber examiners shall meet within thirty (30) days after appointment, for the purpose of organizing, electing a chairman and vice-chairman, and transacting any business which may come before it. The board shall determine the frequency, date, time and place of all meetings. The chairman shall preside at all meetings and the vice-chairman shall preside in the absence of the chairman. The board shall adopt such rules and regulations as it sees fit for the proper and efficient discharge of its official duties. 
    The secretary of the water department will serve as secretary of the board. The secretary shall notify all persons who have made application for a certificate of competency when and where to appear for examination. 
    The board shall determine the character of the examination necessary to ascertain the qualifications, responsibility and experience to be given any applicant for a certificate of competency, and, by the majority of the board members present whether or not the applicant should be given a certificate. At least three (3) members of said board shall preside over all examinations. 
    The board of plumber examiners shall issue master plumber certificates of competency to such persons as may be entitled thereto and certify licensed journeymen and apprenticed plumbers. 
    If the meaning of any actual or implied provision of this code is discovered not to be thoroughly clear, the board shall have the authority to interpret and clarify said provisions. 
    The board shall also recommend such changes as may be practical or desirable for the health and welfare of the community for approval by the city council. The board shall determine those exceptions which may be permitted in hardship cases and shall advise the plumbing inspector of such exceptions in writing. 
    102.3. Plumbing inspector and assistants. To provide for the administration and enforcement of this code, the office of plumbing inspector is hereby created. The mayor may appoint, under civil service regulations, the plumbing inspector and assistants to the plumbing inspector to aid him in the discharge of the duties of his office. Such inspector may also be referred to as "plumbing official." 
    102.4. Plumbing inspector's qualifications. The plumbing inspector and all assistant plumbing inspectors hereafter appointed shall be practical plumbers having five (5) years actual experience as journeymen or master plumbers and shall have passed a satisfactory civil service examination as prescribed by the civil service laws of the city. 
    102.5. Restriction on employees. No officer or employee connected with the department, except one whose only connection is as a member of the board, established by this article, shall be financially interested in the furnishing of labor, material or appliances for the construction, alteration or maintenance of plumbing installations or in the making of plans or specifications therefor, unless he is the owner of such building. No such officer or employee shall engage in any work which is inconsistent with his duties or with the interests of the department. 
    102.6. Records. The plumbing inspector shall keep, or cause to be kept, a record of the business of the plumbing section. The records of the plumbing section shall be open to public inspection at all reasonable times. 
SECTION 103. POWERS AND DUTIES OF PLUMBING INSPECTOR 
    103.1. General. The plumbing inspector shall maintain public office hours necessary to administer efficiently the provisions of this code and amendments thereto, and shall perform the following duties: 
(1)  Examine and check plans and specifications, drawings, descriptions and/or diagrams necessary to show clearly the character, kind and extent of plumbing work covered by applications for a permit and upon approval thereof issue the permit applied for. 
(2)  See that all fees for permits are paid promptly to the tax collector. 
(3)  Inspect all plumbing work authorized by any permit to assure compliance with provisions of this code. 
(4)  Issue a certificate of approval for all work approved by him. 
(5)  Condemn and reject all work done or being done or materials used or being used which do not in all respects comply with the provisions of this code. 
(6)  Order in writing change in workmanship and/or materials essential to obtain compliance with all provisions of this code. 
(7)  Investigate any construction or work regulated by this code and issue such notices and orders as are provided for in this section. 
(8)  Keep a complete record of all the essential transactions of his office. 
(9)  Receive, approve and countersign, all applications for permits to do plumbing work or make water or sewer connections in the city. 
(10)  Maintain an official register of all persons, lawfully entitled to carry on or be engaged in the business of plumbing in the city to whom a plumber's certificate of competency has been issued in accordance with the provisions of this code. 
(11)  Issue citations relevant to the enforcement of this plumbing code. 
    103.2. Right of entry. The plumbing inspector and assistant plumbing inspectors shall carry an official badge of office, upon exhibition of which they shall have the right of entry in the performance of their duties, during usual business hours, to inspect any buildings and premises in the city, and outside the city when buildings or premises, or connections of any nature are made to the city water or sewer systems. 
    103.3. Stop work orders. Upon notice from the plumbing inspector that work on any plumbing installation is being done contrary to the provisions of this code or in a dangerous or unsafe manner, such work shall be immediately stopped. Such notice shall be in writing and shall be given to the owner of such property, or to his agent, or to the person doing the work, and shall state the conditions under which work may be resumed. Where any emergency exists, oral notice given by the plumbing inspector shall be sufficient. 
    103.4. Revocation of permits. The plumbing inspector may revoke a permit or approval, issued under the provisions of this code, in case there has been any false statement or misrepresentation as to a material fact in the application or plans on which the permit or approval was based. In all such cases no permit fees shall be refunded. 
    103.5. Unsafe installations. Whenever brought to the attention of the department having jurisdiction that any unsanitary conditions exist or that any construction or work regulated by this article is dangerous, unsafe, unsanitary or a menace to life, health or property, or is in violation of this code, said department may request an investigation by the plumbing inspector who, upon determining such information to be fact, shall order any person using or maintaining any such condition or responsible for the use or maintenance thereof to discontinue the use or maintenance thereof or to repair, alter, change, remove or demolish same as he may consider necessary for the proper protection of life, health or property. 
    The plumbing inspector shall have the power and authority, where any building, structure or premises contains improper or defective plumbing or where same has been constructed, erected, altered or repaired without a permit as provided by this code or other applicable ordinances of the city, to immediately notify in writing the service department to cut off and discontinue the service of water until such improper or defective plumbing or piping shall be made to fully conform with the code and ordinances, and a certificate of the plumbing inspector shall have been issued. 
    103.6. Requirements not covered by code. Any requirements necessary for the safety, strength or stability of any existing or proposed plumbing installation, or for the safety of the occupants of a building or structure, not specifically covered by this code, shall be determined by the plumbing inspector subject to the administrative authority. 
    103.7. Alternate materials and alternate methods of installations. Alternate plumbing materials and alternate methods of installations shall be approved in accordance with former section 503, Alternate Materials and Methods, which former section is hereby reinstated. 
    103.8. Liability. Any officer or employee, or member of any board, charged with the enforcement of this code, acting for the governing body in the discharge of duties, shall not thereby render himself liable personally and he is hereby relieved from all personal liability for any damage that may occur to persons or property as a result of any act required or permitted in the discharge of his duties. Any suit brought against any officer or employee because of such act performed by him in the enforcement of any provision of this code shall be defended by the legal division until the final termination of the proceedings. 
    103.9. Reports. The plumbing inspector shall annually submit a report to the governing body covering the work of the plumbing section of the department during the preceding year. 
SECTION 104. GENERAL REQUIREMENTS BEFORE DOING PLUMBING 
    104.1. Certification. It shall be unlawful for any person to carry on or engage in the business of plumbing, in the city unless such person has successfully passed an examination conducted by the board of plumber examiners, and has or has had issued to him a plumber's certificate by said board in the manner and in accordance with the provisions of this code. 
    104.2. Registration. Before any person shall carry on or engage in the business of plumbing in the city, he shall first register his name and address with the plumbing inspector, together with such other information as the department may require. 
    104.3. Licenses. Before any person shall carry on or engage in the business of plumbing in the city, he shall first procure a master plumber's license from the city, and pay the annual license fee imposed on such business. Such license shall not be transferable. 
    Every applicant for a master plumber license shall furnish proof that he is the lawful owner of a valid master plumbers certificate of competency. If the applicant be a partnership, firm or corporation, then that person making application on behalf of said partnership, firm or corporation shall furnish proof that he owns at least thirty-five (35) per cent of said partnership, firm or corporation, and he shall further certify that at all times he will be in actual charge of the applicant's plumbing business. When any such person is so designated, such designation shall be in writing and signed by the person designated to act on behalf of said partnership, firm or corporation and one (1) copy shall be filed with the plumbing inspector. 
(a)  Bond. Each applicant for a master plumber's license shall execute and deposit with the tax collector a bond executed by a surety company authorized to do business in the state, in the sum of one thousand dollars ($1,000.00) conditioned that he or they shall indemnify and save harmless the city, and the council thereof, from all suits and actions of every name and description that may be brought against the city, or the council thereof, for or on account of injuries or damage received or sustained, by any person or property, by or in consequence of any acts of omission, commission, negligence, or any improper material or unskilled labor used by him, or for any other cause, on account of the applicant or his agents, employees or workmen, and that he or they shall faithfully perform the work and comply in all respects with the provisions of this article and the rules and regulations established thereunder. Said bond shall be approved by the city council. 
(b)  Fee. Before any master plumber's license shall be issued or renewed the applicant therefor shall pay to the city ten dollars ($10.00) in advance. 
(c)  Expiration. All master plumber's licenses shall expire on the thirty-first day of December of each year unless sooner revoked. 
(d)  Revocation. No person holding a master plumber's license issued by the city shall lend such license to any other person to do any plumbing work under any permit taken out in his name, except certified journeymen plumbers in his employ. A certified journeyman plumber must be on the job site during the time that any plumbing installations are being made. A violation of this section shall be ground for the revocation of such person's license by the plumbing inspector in addition to the other penalties provided for by this code. 
    Any person engaged in the plumbing business whose work does not conform to the rules and regulations herein set out, or whose workmanship or materials are of inferior quality, shall on notice from the plumbing inspector make necessary changes or corrections at once so as to conform to this code; if work has not been so changed after ten (10) days' notice from the plumbing inspector, the plumbing inspector shall refuse to issue any more permits until such work has fully complied with the rules and regulations of this code. The plumbing inspector may appear before the governing body and request that all licenses be revoked because of continuous violations. When the revocation of any such license is to be considered at any meeting, the person to whom the license has been issued shall have at least three (3) days' notice in writing of the time and place of such meeting, together with a statement of the grounds upon which it is proposed to revoke such license. 
    104.4. Reserved. 
    104.5. Public liability insurance. Each licensed master plumber shall carry public liability insurance in the minimum amount of twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000.00) for each person and twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000.00) for each accident, and property damage insurance in the amount of twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000.00) each accident and twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000.00) aggregate, and evidence of this coverage in the form of a certificate of insurance shall be furnished to the city upon application for a master plumber's license. 
    104.6. License required; display of sign. It shall be unlawful for any person not in legal possession of a valid master plumber's license issued by the city to engage in, carry on, or represent himself as engaged in, or carrying on the business of master plumber in the city, or to use the words `master plumber,' or `plumber,' in any advertising, or display or expose a sign having similar import for the purpose of implying the advertiser to be so engaged. 
SECTION 105. RESERVED 
SECTION 106. PERMITS 
    106.1. Application. Any duly licensed master plumber who desires to connect any plumbing work with any sewers, sanitary or storm, septic tank or sewage disposal of any kind, or private connection or install fixtures or appliances in new or existing systems, structures or premises, or repair, or add to any existing plumbing, shall first make application to the plumbing inspector and obtain the required permit therefor. Ordinary minor repairs may be made with the approval of the plumbing inspector without a permit provided that such repairs shall not violate any of the provisions of this code. 
    106.2. Form. Application for a permit shall be made in person. The applicant shall furnish information as may be required to complete the application form furnished by the plumbing inspector. 
    106.3. Drawings and specifications. Whenever, in the opinion of the plumbing inspector, drawings and specifications are needed to show definitely the nature and character of the work for which the application is made the applicant shall furnish such drawings, which shall be drawn to scale and submitted in duplicate. If approved, one set shall be returned to the applicant, marked approved, and one set shall be retained and filed as a permanent record in the office of the plumbing inspector. The applicant's approved set shall remain at all times on the job. Such information or drawings and specifications shall be specific and this code shall not be cited as a whole or in part, nor shall the term legal or its equivalent be issued as a substitute for specific information. 
    106.4. Examination of drawings. The plumbing inspector shall examine or cause to be examined each application for a permit and the drawings and specifications which may be filed therewith, and shall ascertain by such examination whether the plumbing installation indicated and described is in accordance with the requirements of this code and all other pertinent laws and ordinances. 
    106.5. Action on application. (a) If the plumbing inspector is satisfied that the work described in an application for permit and the drawings and specifications which may be filed therewith conform to the requirements of this code, and other pertinent laws and ordinances, he shall issue a permit therefor to the applicant. 
(b)  If the application for permit and the drawings and specifications which may be filed therewith describe work which does not conform to the requirements of this code or other pertinent laws or ordinances, the plumbing inspector shall not issue a permit, but shall return the drawings to the applicant with his refusal to issue such a permit. Such refusal shall, when requested, be in writing and shall contain the reasons therefor. 
    106.6. Condition of the permit. The plumbing inspector shall act upon an application for a permit with plans as filed, or as amended, without unreasonable or unnecessary delay. A permit issued shall be construed to be a license to proceed with the work and shall not be construed as authority to violate, cancel, alter or set aside any of the provisions of this code, nor shall issuance of a permit prevent the plumbing inspector from thereafter requiring correction of errors in plans or in construction, or of violations of this code. Any permit issued shall become invalid unless the work authorized by it shall have been commenced within sixty (60) days after its issuance, or if the work authorized by such permit is suspended or abandoned for a period of ninety (90) days after the time the work is commenced; provided, that for cause, one or more extensions of time for periods not exceeding thirty (30) days each, may be allowed in writing by the plumbing inspector. Before such work can be recommenced a new permit shall be first obtained. In the event this code is amended after a permit is issued, the amendments shall apply to work not started prior to the effective date of the amendment. 
    It shall be unlawful for any person whether acting as principal, servant, agent or employee, to do, or cause, or permit to be done any plumbing work for which a permit is required within the city without first securing a permit from the plumbing inspector, authorizing him so to do. 
    No permit shall be required in the case of any repair work as follows: The stopping of leaks in drains, soil waste or vent pipe; provided, however, that should any trap, soil waste or vent pipe be or become defective and it becomes necessary to remove and replace the same with new material in any part, the same shall be considered as new work and a permit shall be procured and inspection made as herein provided. No permit shall be required for the clearing of stoppages, or repairing of leaks in pipes, valves or fixtures, when such repairs do not involve or require the rearrangement of valves or pipes. 
SECTION 107. FEES 
    107.1. General. Such applicant shall pay to the city tax collector for each permit issued and at the time of issuance, a fee in accordance with the following schedule, and at the rate provided for each classification shown therein. 
    No permit shall be valid until the fees prescribed in this section shall have been paid; nor shall an amendment to a permit be approved until the additional fees, if any, shall have been paid. 
    107.2. Failure to obtain a permit. If any person commences any work on a plumbing installation before obtaining the necessary permit from the city, he shall be subject to the penalty prescribed herein. 
    107.3. Schedule of permit fees. 
(1)  Permit fees: 
First fixture ..... $ 8.00 
Each additional fixture up to 10 ..... 3.00 
All fixtures in excess of 10 ..... 2.00 
Sewer service lines ..... 8.00 
Water service lines ..... 8.00 
(Reinspection fee, 108.2) 
(2)  Sewer connection fees. The sewer connection fees shall be as are from time to time prescribed by the governing body. 
(3)  Water connection fees. The water connection fees shall be as are from time to time prescribed by the governing body. 
(4)  Point of connection. Building sewers and water service pipes shall connect to the public sewer and water main at a point designated by the proper municipal authority. 
(5)  Bills for inspections. The plumbing inspector is required to bill the plumbing contractors on a monthly basis for all inspections and to require payment by the tenth of the following month in order to secure further inspection. 
SECTION 108. INSPECTIONS 
    108.1. Inspection required. All new plumbing work, and such portions of existing systems as may be affected by new work or any changes, shall be inspected to insure compliance with all the requirements of this code and to assure that the installation and construction of the plumbing system is in accordance with approved plans. 
    108.2. Notification. 
(a)  Advance notice. It shall be the duty of the plumber to give reasonable advance notice to the plumbing inspector when plumbing work is ready for test or inspection. 
(b)  Plumber's responsibility. It shall be the duty of the plumber to make sure that the work will stand the test prescribed before giving the above notice. 
(c)  Retesting. If the plumbing inspector finds that the work will not pass the test, the plumber shall be required to make necessary corrections and the work shall then be resubmitted for inspection. Where additional inspections are necessary for retesting there shall be an additional fee of ten dollars ($10.00) for each inspection. 
    108.3. Material and labor for tests. The equipment, material, power and labor necessary for the inspection and test shall be furnished by the plumber. 
    108.4. Test of drainage and vent systems. All the piping of the plumbing system shall be tested with water or air. After the plumbing fixtures have been set and their traps filled with water, the entire drainage system shall be submitted to final tests. The plumbing inspector may require the removal of any cleanouts, to ascertain if the pressure has reached all parts of the system. 
    108.5. Methods of testing drainage and vent systems. 
(a)  Water test. The water test shall be applied to the drainage system either in its entirety or in sections. If applied to the entire system, all openings in the piping shall be tightly closed, except the highest opening, and the system filled with water to point of overflow. If the system is tested in sections, each opening shall be tightly plugged except the highest openings of the section under test, and each section shall be filled with water, but no section shall be tested with less than a ten (10) foot head of water. In testing successive sections at least the upper ten (10) feet of the next preceding section shall be tested, so that no joint or pipe in the building (except the uppermost ten (10) feet of the system) shall have been submitted to a test of less than a ten (10) foot head of water. The water shall be kept in the system, or in the portion under test, for at least fifteen (15) minutes before inspection starts; the system shall then be tight at all points. 
(b)  Air test. The air test shall be made by attaching an air compressor or testing apparatus to any suitable opening and after closing all other inlets and outlets to the system, forcing air into the system until there in a uniform gauge pressure of five (5) pounds per square inch or sufficient to balance a column of mercury ten (10) inches in height. This pressure shall be held without introduction of additional air for a period of at least fifteen (15) minutes. 
(c)  Final test. The final test of the completed drainage and vent system shall be visual and in sufficient detail to insure that the provisions of this code have been complied with; provided, however, that for cause, the plumber may be required to subject the plumbing to either a smoke or peppermint test. Where the smoke test is preferred, it shall be made by filling all traps with water and then introducing into the entire system a pungent, thick smoke produced by one or more smoke machines. When the smoke appears at stack openings on the roof they shall be closed and a pressure equivalent to a one-inch water column shall be built and maintained for fifteen (15) minutes before inspection starts. Where the peppermint test is preferred, two (2) ounces of oil of peppermint shall be introduced for each line or stack. 
    108.6. Test of water supply system. Upon completion of a section or of the entire water supply system, it shall be tested and provided tight under a water pressure not less than twenty-five (25) pounds above the working pressure under which it is to be used. The water used for tests shall be obtained from a potable source of supply. 
    108.7. Test of building sewer. Tests shall consist of plugging end of building sewer at point of connection with the public sewer and filling the building sewer with the water and testing with not less than a ten (10) foot head of water, and test shall be maintained until backfill is completed. 
    108.8. Test of interior leaders or downspouts. Leaders or downspouts and branches within a building shall be tested by water or air in accordance with paragraph 108.5(a) or paragraph 108.5(b). 
    108.9. Covering the work. 
(a)  Prior to test. The plumbing system or part thereof shall not be covered until it has been inspected, tested and approved as prescribed in this section. 
(b)  Uncovering of work. If a plumbing system or part thereof is covered before being inspected, tested and approved as prescribed in this section, it shall be uncovered upon the direction of the plumbing inspector. 
    108.10. Test of defective plumbing. The drainage system of any building, where there is reason to believe that it has become defective, shall be subjected to test or inspection. 
    108.11. Roughing-in inspection. Upon the satisfactory completion of the roughing-in inspection, approval shall be so noted on the plumbing permit card. This approval shall give the date of the roughing-in inspection and the initials of the inspector. 
    108.12. Final inspection. Upon the satisfactory completion and final test of the plumbing system, a certificate of approval shall be issued by the plumbing inspector to be delivered to the owner, and the building shall not be occupied prior to completion of said system and/or issuance of certification of approval. 
SECTION 109. CUTTING OF STREETS, SIDEWALKS, ALLEYS, DRIVEWAYS, ETC. 
    Any person desiring to open any street, alley or sidewalk to make any connection with the city water or sewer system, or for any other reason, shall first make application to the city engineer, and receive a permit to open a street, sidewalk or alley, or connection with the sewer system as the terms of the permit shall specify. In taking out a permit as provided above, the holder of said permit agrees to restore the street, alley or sidewalk to the same condition that existed prior to the opening, under the following specifications: 
(1)  Dirt streets or alleys. Ditch shall be well tamped in six (6) inch layer and in case of settlement party holding said permit agrees to maintain said backfill for one year. 
(2)  Gravel streets or alleys. Ditch shall be tamped in six (6) inch layers to a point of nine (9) inches below the surface of the street after which one foot of good road gravel will be tamped in until level with the surface of the existing streets. Party holding said permit agrees to maintain said backfill for one year. 
(3)  Asphalt treated gravel streets. Ditch shall be taken care of as in the above paragraph and in addition the cut shall be finished by handpouring approximately six-tenths (.6) of a gallon of ninety to one hundred (90: 100) penetration asphalt followed by a covering of what is ordinarily termed chat or torpedo gravel. 
(4)  Paved streets. Ditch shall be flooded and filled with a good quality of backfill gravel and tamped down to a point six (6) inches below the top of the existing concrete base and then filled with six (6) inches of one:three:six (1: 3: 6) concrete mixture. After four (4) days time a surface shall be applied corresponding to the existing surface of the street. 
(5)  Sidewalks, gutters and driveways. Ditch shall be flooded and filled with a good quality of backfill gravel after which a concrete surface shall be applied that meets the specifications for concrete sidewalks, gutters, and driveways of the city. 
    If any opening or excavation is not refilled or restored as herein provided, and approved by the city engineer, it shall be the duty of the city engineer to notify such licensee in writing to refill and restore the same and provided also that if said licensee shall fail to refill and restore the same within three (3) days after receipt of such notice, the city engineer shall report such fact to the mayor, who may thereupon order the city engineer to refill and restore said street or alley at the cost of such licensee and the certification of the city engineer as to the cost of such refilling and restoration shall be conclusive evidence against said licensee as to the cost thereof. No further permits as provided in this code shall be issued by the inspector to such licensee until said cost has been paid. 
SECTION 110. PUBLIC PROTECTION REQUIREMENTS 
(a)  It is required that for every excavation made on public property, proper safeguards shall be provided against injury to the public, barricades shall be provided at five (5) feet distance, and such barricades shall completely encircle all open excavations or trenches. All barricades, as required by this code, shall have at least one sign placed thereon in a conspicuous manner, indicating the name of the person causing such excavation. When approved, steel plates of sufficient strength may be used to cover excavations to prevent blocking of streets. 
(b)  From sunrise to sunset there shall be placed, at a distance of not less than one hundred (100) feet, sufficient numbers of red flags to warn the public of dangerous excavation. From sunset to sunrise there shall be placed at a distance of not less than one hundred (100) feet, sufficient red lights or flambeaux to indicate the length of the excavation in the public thoroughfare, and to warn the public of a dangerous excavation. In addition to the above, there shall be placed on or by the barricades sufficient red lights of flambeaux to indicate the point of excavation and size. 
SECTION 111. RESTRICTIONS 
(a)  Steam boiler supply tank. All persons are prohibited from connecting pipes whereby high pressure steam boiler may be supplied with water direct from the city water mains. All such boilers shall be provided with a tank or other receptacle of sufficient capacity to hold at least twelve (12) hours supply of water in case of a pipe district being shut off to repair water mains, fire hydrants, or make connections or extensions. In such cases, the city will not be responsible for lack of water for steam boilers for any purpose. 
(b)  Fire prevention. Connection for fire protection shall be made independent of all other service pipes. 
(c)  Meter. Each property owner may be permitted to supply one or more buildings from one meter, provided the size of meter and service line meet the requirements of the code. No person shall place a waterline across a street or alley. 
SECTION 112. RESPONSIBILITY AND LIABILITY 
    This code shall not be construed to relieve from or lessen the responsibility or liability of any party owning, operating, controlling or installing any plumbing for damage to person or property caused from any defect therein, nor shall the city be held as assuming any such liability by reason of the inspection authorized herein, or certificate of approval issued as herein provided. 
SECTION 113. VIOLATIONS AND PENALTIES 
    Any person who shall violate a provision of this code or fail to comply with any of the provisions thereof, or violate a detailed statement or plans submitted and approved thereunder, shall be guilty of a misdemeanor. Each such person shall be deemed guilty of a separate offense for each day or portion thereof during which any violation of any of the provisions of this code is committed or continued, and upon conviction in the court of jurisdiction for any such violation such person shall be punished as provided in section 1-8 of this Code of Ordinances. 
SECTION 114. VALIDITY OF ORDINANCE 
    If any section, subsection, sentence, clause or phrase of this code is, for any reason, held to be unconstitutional, such decision shall not affect the validity of the remaining portion of the code. 
    Chapter VII entitled "Traps and Cleanouts" of said Standard Plumbing Code and particularly section 701.2 entitled "Distance of Trap to Fixture" is hereby amended to read as follows: 
    "701.2-Distance of trap to fixture. The vertical distance from the fixture outlet of the trap weir, or from the outlet of an integrally trapped water closet or similar fixture to the horizontal piping connecting the fixture to its vent, shall not exceed forty-eight (48) inches." 
    Chapter XVI entitled "Alternate Designed Plumbing Systems" of the current revised edition of the Southern Standard Plumbing Code, is amended by deleting therefrom section 1602.6(c) entitled "Arrangement" including Table 6 attached thereto. 
(Code 1956, §§ 22-3.1-22-3.4; Ord. No. 42-1986, § 2, 3-25-86; Ord. No. 132-1986, § 2, 7-29-86; Ord. No. 50-1987, § 2, 3-24-87; Ord. No. 132-2005, §§ I, II, 5-12-05; Ord. No. 184-2013, § I, 10-18-2013) 
Secs. 7-144-7-149. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE VII. - TELEVISION APPARATUS OR EQUIPMENT[4] 
Footnotes: 
--- (4) --- 
Cross reference- Cable television franchise regulations, § 24.5-16 et seq. 

DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY 

Sec. 7-150. - Scope of article. 
    The construction, installation and maintenance of television apparatus or equipment within the city shall be subject to the provisions contained in this article. 
(Code 1956, § 10-52) 
Sec. 7-151. - Electrical materials, devices, apparatus. 
(a)  No materials, devices or apparatus designed for attachment to or installation on any electrical circuit or system for television antennas or equipment, shall be installed, used, sold or offered for sale in the city unless such materials, devices or apparatus are in conformity with the approved methods of construction for safety to life and property. 
(b)  Conformity of electrical materials, devices or apparatus with the standards of the Underwriters' Laboratories, Inc., shall be held to mean that these materials are included in an indicated list of inspected electrical appliances published and distributed by the Underwriters' Laboratories, Inc., and the standards approved by the American Standards Association and the city. 
(c)  The maker's name, trademark or other identification symbol shall be placed on all electrical material, devices or apparatus which are used or offered for sale in the city. These markings and others such as voltage, amperage, wattage, impedance and power-factor or appropriate ratings described in the National Electrical Code are necessary to determine the character of the material, device or equipment and the use for which it is intended and approved. 
(Code 1956, § 10-53) 
Cross reference- Adoption of National Electrical Code, § 7-56. 
Sec. 7-152. - Inspection, investigation, re-inspection; notice and time permitted to correct hazardous conditions. 
(a)  It shall be the duty of the electrical inspector to inspect all television installations to ascertain if the work has been done in a workmanlike manner and to investigate all complaints from the general public pertaining to television and antenna installations. 
(b)  The electrical inspector is hereby empowered to inspect or re-inspect any wiring, equipment or apparatus conducting or using electric current for television service in the city and if conductors, equipment or apparatus are found to be unsafe to life or property, or are not in conformity with national standards or local requirements, the inspector shall notify the person owning or operating the hazardous equipment, to correct the condition within a forty-eight (48) hour period within the time the inspector specifies. Failure to correct violations in the specified time constitutes a violation of this article. 
(Code 1956, § 10-54) 
Cross reference- See § 7-46 et seq. 
Sec. 7-153. - Interference with electrical inspector or authorized representatives. 
    It shall be unlawful for any person to hinder or interfere with the electrical inspector or the inspector's authorized representatives in the discharge of their duties under the provisions of this article. 
(Code 1956, § 10-55) 
Sec. 7-154. - Antenna installation permit-Required. 
    Before any television antenna is constructed or installed, the owner or occupant of the premises must make application at the office of the electrical inspector for a permit and obtain same and pay the required fees set forth in this division. 
(Code 1956, § 10-56) 
Sec. 7-155. - Same-Fees; re-inspection. 
(a)  The following fees shall be charged and collected by the office of the electrical inspector, which shall include the issuance of the permit and the inspection: 
(1)  Domestic television antenna, each ..... $2.00 
(2)  Commercial television antenna, each ..... 3.00 
(b)  A re-inspection fee of one dollar ($1.00) shall be made for each trip when extra inspections are necessary due to any one of the following reasons: 
(1)  Wrong address. 
(2)  Condemned work resulting from faulty construction. 
(3)  Repairs or corrections not made when inspection is called. 
(4)  Work not ready for inspection when called. 
The payment or re-inspection fees shall be made before any further permits will be issued to the person owing same. 
(Code 1956, § 10-57) 
Sec. 7-156. - Same-Authority for electrical inspector to refuse issuance for specified period to persons violating article. 
    If any person violates any provision of this article the electrical inspector may for a period of six (6) months thereafter refuse to issue any permit to such violator. 
(Code 1956, § 10-58) 
Sec. 7-157. - Work to conform to article and city electrical code. 
    The work performed under a permit must conform to the rules and regulations contained in this article and in the, from time to time, current edition of the city electrical code. 
(Code 1956, § 10-59) 
Cross reference- See § 7-56 et seq. 
Sec. 7-158. - Notice to electrical inspector that work is ready for inspection. 
    When the work has been completed the holder of the permit must notify the electrical inspector that the work is ready for inspection and same must be inspected and approved by such official before use. 
(Code 1956, § 10-60) 
Sec. 7-159. - Special rules and regulations for construction and installation. 
    The following special rules and regulations shall govern television construction and installation in the city: 
(1)  Masts must be of corrosive-resistant material, and if installed on a roof, must be mounted on its own platform of corrosive-resistant metal of at least four (4) inches by four (4) inches, and mast must be securely anchored with guy wires. Masts, antennas or guy wires, must not be fastened directly to the roof or so as to damage the roof in any manner. 
(2)  Whenever it is required, for performance or mechanical reasons, to install the antenna above the street or near power lines, or where damage would be caused by its falling, a separate safety wire must be attached to the cross arm of the antenna, and secured in a direction away from the hazard. 
(3)  Transmission lines must be kept at least six (6) inches clear of telephone, light and power wires. 
(4)  Stand-off support insulators must be used at least every ten (10) feet in running the transmission line. 
(5)  Lightning arrestors shall be installed so that both sides of the transmission line are adequately protected. 
(6)  If coaxial cable or shielded twin lead is used for the lead-in, suitable protection may be provided without lightning arrestors by grounding the exterior metal sheath. When the center of folded dipole is connected to a grounded mast, no lightning arrestors will be needed. 
(7)  Guy wires must be galvanized three thirty-seconds ( 3/32 ) of an inch, five (5) strand cable or equivalent. 
(8)  Ground wires must be of the type approved in the current issue of the National Electrical Code for grounding masts in lightning arrestors, and must be installed in a mechanical manner with as few bends as possible, maintaining a clearance of at least two (2) inches from combustible material. 
(9)  Ground straps for grounding masts and attaching arrestors to water pipe must be the approved type. 
(10)  Turnbuckles must be protected against turning by threading the guy wire through the turnbuckle. 
(11)  Every antenna mast must be adequately grounded. 
(12)  Band iron may be used to secure masts to chimneys or other structures provided brackets are not used. Mast must be parallel to and in contact with chimney. 
(13)  Band iron or straps that encircle chimneys or other structures shall not be used to support brackets unless assembled as a unit and as so approved. 
(Code 1956, § 10-61) 
Secs. 7-160-7-164. - Reserved.

Sec. 7-165. - Installation, material, fittings, etc., to conform to regulations of National Electrical Code and installed by electrical contractors. 
    The wiring system for community antenna television and radio distribution systems and master antenna systems shall comply with all applicable provisions of the current edition of the National Electrical Code. All raceways, whether rigid metal conduit, electrical metallic conduit, flexible metal conduit, rigid nonmetallic conduit, or other, as approved for the installation of community antenna television and radio distribution systems and master antenna systems shall be installed by electrical contractors certificated and bonded by the city.

Sec. 7-166. - Permits required; inspection. 
    All persons engaged in the business of installing community antenna television and radio distribution systems and master antenna systems shall before proceeding with such installations first secure a permit from the office of the electrical inspector and pay the inspection fee required by this division. All work covered by this division shall not be covered or concealed prior to inspection. The electrical inspector shall be notified when work is ready for final inspection and such work shall be inspected within seventy-two (72) hours (Saturdays, Sundays and holidays excluded) of the time of notification.

    The following inspection fees shall be charged for community antenna television and radio distribution systems and master antenna systems installations: Two dollars ($2.00) minimum fee for the first six (6) outlets, and fifty cents ($0.50) per outlet for all additional outlets in an installation covered by a single permit. 
(Code 1956, § 10-65)

ARTICLE VIII. - SWIMMING POOL CODE 

Sec. 7-170. - Code adopted by reference. 
    There is hereby adopted for the purposes of prescribing regulations governing the construction of swimming pools within the corporate limits, that certain code known as the Swimming Pool Code, as published by the "2000 International Residential Code for One and Two Family Dwellings, Appendix G Swimming Pools, Spa and Hot Tubs" by reference and "International Code Council, 2000 International Building Code, Section 3109, Swimming Pool Enclosures" by reference, except such portions that may be hereinafter deleted, modified or amended by this chapter, of which code not less than three (3) copies have been signed and are now filed in the office of the city clerk and which have been signed by the mayor and clerk for identification with this chapter, and the same is hereby adopted and incorporated as fully as if set out at length herein and from the date on which this section takes effect the provisions thereof shall be controlling within the limits of the city. 
(Code 1956, § 7-8; Ord. No. 123-1978, § 1, 9-5-78; Ord. No. 133-1980, § 2, 8-5-80; Ord. No. 246-2003, §§ I, II, 8-5-2003) 
Sec. 7-171. - Severability. 
    Each phrase, sentence, paragraph and section of the electrical swimming pool code herein adopted is hereby declared to be severable and independent, and should any such phrase, sentence, paragraph or section be declared invalid by any court of competent jurisdiction, such declaration shall not affect the operation of the remaining portions thereof. 
Sec. 7-172. - Penalty for violation. 
    Anyone who violates the provisions of the swimming pool code as adopted and amended herein shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction shall be punished as provided in section 1-8 of the Code of Ordinances. The conviction for such violation on any occasion shall not prevent prosecution for subsequent violations and each day that the swimming pool code as adopted herein is violated shall constitute a separate offense. 
Sec. 7-173. - Enforcement by injunction. 
    There is reserved to the city the right to proceed to enforce the provisions of the swimming pool code herein adopted by injunction and the conviction for violating its terms shall not in any manner affect or interfere with the right of the city in a civil proceeding to enforce the swimming pool code and its regulations or enjoin the violation thereof. 
Secs. 7-174-7-179. - Reserved.

    [The code enforcement officer shall be] an employee(s) of the City of Alexandria so designated by the mayor to enforce the various codes listed in section 7-181. 
(Ord. No. 148-1992, § 2, 6-9-92)
